message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CY 

This paper deals with the problem of extracting Adverse-Drug-Reaction (ADR) mentions from social media, specifically from Twitter. This task involves natural language processing and information extraction, which falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also proposes a novel semi-supervised learning based RNN model, which involves machine learning and deep neural networks, falling under the categories of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The use of social media data for pharmacovigilance also involves information retrieval (cs.IR) and social network analysis (cs.SI). Finally, the paper deals with the challenges of working with short and highly informal text, which could also fall under the category of cybernetics (cs.CY).
